title: How to Make Cabbage Salsa

steps.headline: Shred the cabbage into small squares about the size of an average human's thumbnail.
steps.description: This is optional if you like big chunks you could just tear the leaves into small pieces

steps.headline: Take out the chopper if you have one (this is a bowl with a blade that you usually crank).
Slice tomatoes in half, then the other way, put them in the chopper.
steps.description: If your chopper's blades are dull or the quality is low, then it would just be better to chop the tomatoes as they can turn out mushy.

steps.headline: Slice the jalapeños in half and put them in the chopper.
steps.description: Jalepeños are a type of pepper.

steps.headline: Spice the salsa with garlic and salt.
Refrigerate for at least an hour.

text: Shred the cabbage into small squares about the size of an average human's thumbnail. This is optional if you like big chunks you could just tear the leaves into small pieces Take out the chopper if you have one (this is a bowl with a blade that you usually crank).  Slice tomatoes in half, then the other way, put them in the chopper. If your chopper's blades are dull or the quality is low, then it would just be better to chop the tomatoes as they can turn out mushy. Slice the jalapeños in half and put them in the chopper. Jalepeños are a type of pepper. Crank the chopper very fast.  Empty components into a container.  Spice the salsa with garlic and salt.  Refrigerate for at least an hour.  Finished.
